description: From Middle English hertly, hertely, hertelyche, from Old English *heortlīċ, *ġeheortlīċ (attested only as an adverb: ġeheortlīċe (“thoroughly, virorously”)), equivalent to heart +‎ -ly.

adjectives.description: heartly (comparative heartlier or more heartly, superlative heartliest or most heartly)

entries.meaning: (rare) Full of heart; cordial; from the heart; hearty
examples: Great scarcity of every necessary of life in this house but the man is glad to see us, and gives us the best he has got with a heartly welcome.

description: From Middle English hertly, hertliche, from Old English ġeheortlīċe (“thoroughly; virorously”), equivalent to heart +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: heartly (comparative heartlier or more heartly, superlative heartliest or most heartly)

entries.meaning: (archaic) In a hearty or heart-felt manner; cordially; heartily
